lead_paragraph: FIFA, soccer’s world governing body, could bar the World Cup champion, Italy, and all Italian clubs from international competition if Juventus goes ahead with its plan to challenge in state court the sanctions it received in the country’s match-fixing scandal. A FIFA spokesman, Andreas Herren, said yesterday that forcing a decision before a state court would interfere with the autonomy of the soccer world and undermine the sport’s arbitration system. A ruling on July 14 stripped Juventus of its last two Serie A titles and relegated the team to the second division.
